de.affect.personality

Class Personality

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.affect.personality.Personality

  • public final class Personality
extends java.lang.Object
    The Personality class represents the personality traits of a character. Personality is a quintuple of the different personality traits: openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, and neuroticism
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Gebhard (based on work of Wenji Mao and Martin Klesen)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Personality(double openness, double conscientiousness, double extraversion, double agreeableness, double neurotism)
      Constructs a new Personality object with the specified values for each personality trait.
      Personality(double openness, double conscientiousness, double extraversion, double agreeableness, double neurotism, PersonalityEmotionsRelations perEmoRels)
      Constructs a new Personality object with the specified values for each personality trait.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Personality

        public Personality(double openness,
           double conscientiousness,
           double extraversion,
           double agreeableness,
           double neurotism,
           PersonalityEmotionsRelations perEmoRels)
        Constructs a new Personality object with the specified values for each personality trait.
        Parameters:
        openness - the degree of openness.
        conscientiousness - the degree of conscientiousness.
        extraversion - the degree of extraversion.
        agreeableness - the degree of agreeableness.
        neurotism - the degree of neurotism.
        perEmoRels - the influcene of personality on emotions
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the degree is not a real number in the interval [-1.0,1.0].

      • Personality

        public Personality(double openness,
           double conscientiousness,
           double extraversion,
           double agreeableness,
           double neurotism)
        Constructs a new Personality object with the specified values for each personality trait.
        Parameters:
        openness - the degree of openness.
        conscientiousness - the degree of conscientiousness.
        extraversion - the degree of extraversion.
        agreeableness - the degree of agreeableness.
        neurotism - the degree of neurotism.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the degree is not a real number in the interval [-1.0,1.0].

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares this personality to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is a Personality object with the same value for each personality trait.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the object to compare this personality against.
        Returns:
        true if the two personalities are equal; false otherwise.
